content.location: Route #1 for the Monolith Block area in Sven's Guide. The route is pictured in the guide as well.

content.description: Route climbs the largest face on the largest single feature at Monolith Blocks.  It lies to the right of the prominent 5.4 chimney route #10 page 199 3d Edition "Climbers Guide to Devil's Lake" and to the left and around the corner of route #8 (called "The Open Wide Burger" on MP.com).  Climb starts by climbing lower groove at wall base center to gain a horizontal fracture and slopng foot ledges.  Angle left here and use small horizontal edges and side pull weaknesses to gain the crux of the climb at the point where the climber passes through the visible small overhanging band.  Gain a sizable flake while moving right towards the route's upper crack.  I think this is a height dependent type of face climb.  It may be 5.11b to a tall lanky climber and 5.11+ to shorter climbers.  The name is a reference to a "Joe Satriani" album from the late 1980's.  Am I wrong about that?
content.protection: Some protection options but with sizable runouts for a lead attempt.  Good small protection to be found in the upper crack.  This would be a tough lead.
content.location: Monolith Blocks.  Route climbs the most expansive and prominent face at Monolith and faces Devil's Lake directly west.
In the corner just to the right of "Rusty Crack"

content.description: A nice mix of hand crack and face climbing holds.  A high step low, a bulge up high ... this little climb actually holds a nice variety of problems.
content.protection: Medium nuts to thin-hand sized cams.  About 3-4 pieces.
content.location: A little North of the Blocks (left as you are on the ground facing the climbs).  Scramble around the blocks on the North about 20-30 feet and cut sharply uphill.  The route is in a little alcove behind a clump of birch.

content.description:
Climb the colorful crack. When the crack runs out, climb right of the corner in the slanting dihedral (not as easy as it looks).

 This is the unnamed #15 in Swartling/Mayer, and a variation of Knower's #15.
content.location: From the south block of the main Monolith Blocks area, go south/southeast about 100 ft to a separate small buttress. Roy G. Biv is just left of the 2 trees.

content.description: Climb the thin face without using the corner on the left (Soul Satori) or the crack on the right (Foil).
content.location: Look for a face with no significant cracks on the northwest side of the south block of Monolith.

content.description: A gorgeous crack!  Starts off with steep fingers and hands, then turns into an off-width struggle at the top.  Reminds me of "Via Apia".
content.protection: Gear to 2-3 inches is adequate, but you'll appreciate gear to 8-10 inches for the upper offwidth.
content.location:
Heading South from Elephant Rock, pass the Tomahawk and the Monolith Blocks.  Where the trail dips into a little saddle, beyond (South of) Monolith Blocks (and before the Monolith bouldering area), turn right (East) and walk North along the base of the rock for 10-20 yards. 

  N 43.42233   W 89.72404

content.description: On the narrow face facing the Lake, climb on or just left of the right-hand (S) corner.
content.protection: Maybe one piece of gear about halfway?
content.location: On the narrow, outside face of the central block.

content.description: Climb the narrow face and up over a shallow overhang without using the corners on either side. Using the left corner makes it a 5.8.
content.location: On the lake side of the south block is a narrow face with a slanting crack that forms a slight overhang about half way up.

content.description: Climb the right side of the face, left of the corner. Pull over the right side of the 2 ft roof about half way up.
content.location: From the south block of the main Monolith Blocks area, go south/southeast about 100 ft to a separate small buttress. Pink Panther is on the tree-less NW facing wall.

content.description: Nice OW crack climb. The route is fairly short, but too tall to boulder. Stay in the crack and practice your OW skills.
content.location: Route #8 at the Monolith Block area in Sven's guide. Very easy to find using the guidebook.

content.description:
Climb the wide chimney that separates the north block from the main wall. Finish on the main wall above the chockstone.

 This is a named climb in Knower's book and the unnamed #7 in Swartling/Mayer.
content.location: Scramble up the boulders between the north block and south block. Look to the left for the wide chimney between the north block and the main wall.

content.description: A little contrived, but some nice moves nonetheless.  Climb the face to the right of "Foil", avoiding the handcrack.
content.protection: Something in the horizontal crack, and side gear in "Foiled".
content.location: On the NE side of the central block, between the handcrack and the right-hand edge.

content.description: Nice moves.  The crux is getting off the ground:  either start flat-footed with a very long reach, step up on the block to your left, or work up a few face holds a little to the right until you reach the horizontal crack.  Get your first piece of gear here.  The upper crack is much easier, and pretty straighforward.
content.location: On the NE side of the central block is an obvious hand crack that doesn't quite reach the ground.

content.description: A chimney with lots of features inside.
content.location: The chimney to the left of "Surfing"

content.description:
Start on the 90 degree corner next to a big detached block, then up the small dihedral imbedded in the corner, and finish on the sharper corner of the summit block.

 This is the unnamed #12 in Swartling/Mayer, and a variation of Rusty Crack in Knower's book.
content.location: The northern-most corner of the Monolith Blocks area. Start about 6 ft left of Rusty Crack.

content.description:
Climb the dark tight chimney. Above the chimney, stay right of the slanting dihedral of Roy G. Biv.

 This is the unnamed #14 in Swartling/Mayer, and #15 in Knower's book.
content.location: From the south block of the main Monolith Blocks area, go south/southeast about 100 ft to a separate small buttress. Behind 2 trees, Alexander's band is the dark chimney between the colorful walls on either side.

content.description: Similar in layout to the Elephant Rocks area, but a little further South.  In addition to the Monolith Blocks proper, there are a number of good climbs scattered on various rocks near here.
